intro: Sida guineensis, commonly known as Guinea groundnut, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by pods containing edible seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats. Sida guineensis is valued for its nutritional seeds and has traditional medicinal uses in some cultures.
